parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
A Cretan, an inhabitant of Crete. From Krete; a Cretan, i.e. Inhabitant of Crete.
From an obsolete primary noun; 'ever, 'by qualification regularly; by implication, earnestly.
A liar, deceiver. From pseudomai; a falsifier.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.
Properly: a wild beast, hence: any animal; met: a brute. Diminutive from the same as thera; a dangerous animal.
Idle, lazy, thoughtless, unprofitable, injurious. (by implication) lazy, useless.
The stomach; by analogy, the matrix; figuratively, a gourmand.
